description: Removal of 2 no. existing telephone boxes and installation of freestanding 'Street Hub' phone and web communications structure with double sided illuminated digital advertisement panel.
decision_conditions: Reason : 1 - The proposed Street Hub structure, by reason of its scale, design, location, size and the nature, number and scale of advertisement panels, would pose a potential distraction to road users which would result in harm to public safety. It would fail to comply with the Mayor's Vision Zero which aims to eradicate deaths and serious injuries from London's transport network. Whilst the proposal would result in some facilities for the general public, these benefits are low and do not outweigh the harm identified. The proposal fails to demonstrate how the proposal would deliver improvements that support the 10 Healthy Streets Indicators in line with Transport for London guidance. The proposal fails to comply with the NPPF, policies T2 and T4 of the London Plan (2021), and policies DMS8 and DMT1 of the DMPD (2016). It would also fail to comply with policies LP9, LP49 and LP50 of the emerging local plan (2023).

Reason : 2 - In dealing with this application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive manner and the Council has, as far as practicable, sought solutions to problems arising in relation to dealing with the planning application. We have made available detailed advice in the form of our statutory policies in the Local Plan consisting of the Core Strategy, Development Management Policies Document, Supplementary Planning documents and where appropriate the Site Specific Allocations Document as well as offering a full pre application advice service. However, we have been unable to seek solutions to problems as the principle of the proposal is clearly contrary to our statutory policies and negotiation could not overcome the reasons for refusal.
